topic: Do AI Tutors Actually Work? What 2024–2025 Meta-analyses Say
target_audience: institutional leaders, instructional designers, and faculty considering AI tutoring tools

refs.ref_string: Qi Xia et al. (2025) Systematic review & meta-analysis
refs.content: Across higher education, GenAI applications show positive, significant effects on behaviour and cognitive achievement; calls out study-design heterogeneity and publication bias checks.

refs.ref_string: Zhang & Jantakoon (2025) Meta-analysis of AI in Education
refs.content: Aggregates 13 empirical studies; reports a significant overall effect of AI technologies in educational settings; discusses methodological considerations in effect-size estimation.

refs.ref_string: Létourneau et al. (2025) Systematic review of K–12 ITS
refs.content: Growth of AI-driven intelligent tutoring systems; mixed but generally positive learning effects; highlights evaluation design issues and context-dependence.

special_instructions: Summarize effect sizes and boundaries of current evidence; provide a due-diligence checklist for piloting AI tutors (data, pedagogy, outcomes, safeguards).
